Did you know that the pulley system on a well in a village, the inclined ramp at a loading dock, and the bottle opener in your kitchen drawer are all simple machines? They all multiply force to make work easier!

ðŸ’¡ The Simple Core

A simple machine is a device that changes the magnitude or direction of a force. Six types: lever, pulley, wheel and axle, inclined plane, wedge, screw. Key concept: Mechanical Advantage (MA) = Load Ã· Effort. MA > 1 means you apply less force to lift more. But energy is conserved â€” you gain force but lose distance (or vice versa). Efficiency = (useful output work Ã· input work) Ã— 100%.

ðŸŽ¯ The Show

A lever (like a see-saw or a crowbar) uses a fulcrum. Placing the fulcrum near the load gives high MA â€” the dhobi uses a wooden stick as a lever to wring clothes. An inclined plane (ramp) lets you move a heavy gas cylinder onto a truck without lifting it straight up. Pulleys are used in construction cranes across Indian cities!
